- **Salient Object Detection:**
  * Salient object detection is the process of simulating human attention in prioritizing objects for high-level processing.
  * It has various applications such as recognition, image and video compression, video summarization, media re-targeting and photo collage, image quality assessment, image segmentation, content-based image retrieval and image collection browsing, image editing and manipulating, visual tracking, object discovery, and human-robot interaction.
  * A large number of saliency detection methods have been proposed in the past 7 years, which involve two steps: selecting objects to process and segmenting the object area.

- **Challenges in Salient Object Detection:**
  * Current models perform well on scenes with single objects but struggle with complex cluttered scenes with several objects.
  * The main challenges are the lack of suitable benchmark datasets for scaling up models and model development and a widely-agreed objective definition of the most salient object.
  * The paper aims to provide solutions for these problems and discover which component might be the weakest link in the possible failure of models when migrating to complex scenes.

- **Related Topics:**
  * Some related topics to visual saliency modeling and salient object detection include object importance, object proposal generation, memorability, scene clutter, image interestingness, video interestingness, surprise, image quality assessment, scene typicality, aesthetic, and attributes.
  * The earliest models, such as the one proposed by Itti et al., generated the first wave of interest in image saliency in computer vision and neuroscience communities.
  * Subsequent studies started to predict fixations with saliency models to verify models and understand human visual attention.
  * A second wave of interest appeared with works of Liu et al. and Achanta et al., who treated saliency detection as a binary segmentation problem.
</summary>

• Heegaard Floer theory is a decorated topological quantum field theory (TQFT) in 2 dimensions, constructed by Ozsváth and Szabó. It associates a vector space over a field to a closed, connected, oriented 3-manifold with a τ₂-structure, and a map to a 4-dimensional cobordism decorated with a τ₂-structure.

• The maps associated to cobordisms can be used to detect exotic smooth structures on 4-manifolds with boundary. For example, the nucleus of an elliptic surface can be used to show that two homeomorphic but not diffeomorphic 4-manifolds have different Heegaard Floer invariants. The original definitions of the vector spaces and maps in Heegaard Floer theory involved counting pseudoholomorphic disks and triangles in symmetric products of Riemann surfaces, which can be related to 3-manifolds and cobordisms via Heegaard diagrams. However, a combinatorial description of these invariants was later developed by Sarkar and the third author, which allows for the computation of the Heegaard Floer homology of any 3-manifold and null homologous knots and links in any 3-manifold. The goal of this paper is to give a combinatorial procedure for calculating the ranks of the maps associated to cobordisms with certain properties.

• Advancements in calcium phosphate (CaP) coated implantable medical devices:
  • Minimize immune response to the implant
  • Capability to store and release one or more medicinally active agents into the body in a controlled manner

• Background:
  • Cardiovascular stents widely used in coronary angioplasty procedures
  • Placement of metallic stents often leads to harmful side effects, such as inflammatory restenosis
  • Restenosis requires repeat surgical treatment within 1-2 years
  • Modifications to the surface of metallic implantable medical devices can diminish the effects of inflammatory restenosis

• Current surface modification techniques:
  • Thin polymer film coating impregnated with medically active agents
  • Biodegradable polymers, such as polylactic acid and polyglycolic acid, frequently used
  • Coatings are flexible and non-thrombogenic

• Limitations of current techniques:
  • Even biodegradable polymers can cause inflammatory response
  • Polymer coated stents may not perform as expected in longer term use
  • Rapidly resorbing polymer coatings can quickly deplete, exposing bare metal surface and causing adverse tissue response

• Desired characteristics for coating implantable medical devices:
  • Entirely biocompatible, causing no adverse effects in tissue
  • Ability to deliver one or more pharmaceutically active agents to a targeted site
  • Porous coatings may accept drugs through adsorption and release in a controlled manner

• Materials for coating implantable medical devices:
  • Calcium phosphate (CaP) family of materials, including hydroxyapatite (HA), di- and tri-calcium phosphates, and partially or fully amorphous calcium phosphates
  • Fully bio-compatible and bio-resorbable with no side effects
  • Hydroxyapatite (HA) is a principal inorganic component of bone, offering new perspectives for coating-based drug encapsulation and delivery systems

</summary>

• The document describes a nerve guidance conduit (NGC) for nerve repair and regeneration.
• The NGC is designed to improve upon current treatments, such as end-to-end suturing and autografts, by using biomaterials to create natural or synthetic nerve guidance conduits (NGCs).
• The NGCs act as an essential precursor for nerve repair, since they can reduce tension at the suture line, protect the regenerating axons from scar tissue, and exhibit a low immune response.
• The NGC of the present invention includes an inner spiral structured porous sheet, which can increase the surface area available for cell migration and attachment, and reduce the length of time needed for recovery.
• The spiral structure can also reduce wear and tear and improve the mechanical properties of the NGC.
• The NGC is tunable, with its length and diameter able to be varied depending on the size of its intermediate sheet.
• The method of fabricating the conduit does not limit its length, enabling its application for longer gap repair/regeneration for PNI.
• The NGC has been tested in rats, with results showing improved functional recovery compared to non-grafted and T groups.

• The text is about a biological oil composition derived from a marine copepod and its effects on atherosclerosis and blood cholesterol level in mice.
	• The copepod oil composition is rich in EPA and DHA, but it also contains other components such as free fatty acids, wax esters, sterols, and pigments.
	• The oil composition of the present invention has been found to have markedly different biological effects than a concentrated preparation of EPA and DHA used in the same concentration as in the copepod oil.
	• The copepod oil composition significantly reduces plaque formation in the aortas of female mice, while more lipids are deposited in lipid storage tissues.
	• The copepod oil also lowers blood cholesterol level in the experimental animals, unlike purified EPA and DHA at the same concentration.

• The invention relates to methods and apparatus for providing ventilatory assistance matched to a subject's respiratory need.
• The invention is suitable for spontaneously breathing human subjects requiring long-term ventilatory assistance, particularly during sleep.
• Most known ventilatory devices do not accurately match the amplitude and phase of mask pressure to the subject's spontaneous efforts, leading to discomfort or panic.
• During sleep, there are changes in the neural control of breathing and the mechanics of the subject's airways, leading to a need for substantially increased ventilatory support.
• Ideally, a ventilatory assistance device should meet the following goals: (i) closely match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts while awake, (ii) automatically adjust the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum ventilation during sleep without relying on the integrity of the subject's chemoreflexes, and (iii) continue to work correctly in the presence of large leaks.
• Most simple home ventilators fail to meet goal (ii) of adjusting the degree of assistance to maintain at least a given ventilation and goal (iii) of closely matching the subject's respiratory phase.
• Servo-ventilators measure ventilation and adjust the degree of assistance to maintain ventilation at or above a specified level, but they still fail to meet goal (i) of closely matching the phase of the subject's spontaneous efforts.
• Proportional assist ventilation (PAV) tailors the pressure vs time profile within a breath to unload the subject's resistive and elastic work, but it has disadvantages such as overestimation of V(t) in the presence of leaks and reliance on the subject's chemoreceptor reflexes.
• The invention seeks to match the phase and degree of assistance to the subject's spontaneous efforts when ventilation is well above a target ventilation, automatically adjust the degree of assistance to maintain at least a specified minimum average ventilation without relying on the integrity of the subject's chemoreflexes, and provide some immunity to the effects of sudden leaks.
• The invention discloses methods for calculating the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle, determining the instantaneous phase in the respiratory cycle as a continuous variable, and measuring the average respiratory

• The invention is an electro-surgical dissecting and cauterizing instrument for use in endoscopic procedures.
• It includes a distal, working tip electrode and a proximal end with an electric plug for connection to a conventional electro-surgical unit.
• The electric energy is delivered to the distal, working tip of the tool via a conductive rod surrounded by a linear, rigid sleeve formed of an insulating material.
• The distal end of the tool includes an electrically conductive, rigid arm extending from the sleeve portion of the tool, which is laterally offset from the longitudinal axis of the sleeve.
• The working tip electrode is formed at the free end of the arm and is used to make direct contact with the patient at the internal operation site.
• A thin jacket of insulating material is disposed upon the arm from the point where it extends from the sleeve right up to, but not including, the working tip electrode.

• The invention is useful in surgical procedures that may or may not include the use of an endoscope to view the operation site.
• The surgical procedure using an endoscope is termed laparoscopic and targets the abdominal area.
• The surgeon inserts the distal end of the instrument into the abdomen of the anesthetized patient through a trochar positioned within an incision made in the abdominal wall.

	+ **Axial discharge duct** defined by an outer pipe and an end face.
	+ **Radial feed ducts** defined by radial feed pipes and radial discharge ducts.
	+ **Bypass means** for removing air bubbles accumulating around the axis of rotation.

- **Bypass design variations:**
	+ **Bypass 11** in FIG. 1: Arranged on the axis of rotation with its outlet opening into the axial feed duct.
	+ **Bypass 12** in FIG. 2: Designed in the form of a T-pipe, with radially extending portions opening into the discharge duct.
	+ **Bypass 13** in FIG. 3: Designed as a radially arranged pipe with an insert having a spiral groove to increase hydrodynamic resistance.
	+ **Bypass 14** in FIG. 4: Similar to bypass 13, but arranged at any desired point of the inner pipe.
	+ **Bypass 15** in FIG. 5: Designed as a coiled pipe arranged at one end of the outer pipe.

- **Air bubble removal:**
	+ Air bubbles accumulate around the axis of rotation due to lowest pressure point.
	+ Bypass inlet openings are provided in the space around the axis of rotation.
	+ Bypass flow eliminates air or gas bubbles.

- **Hydrodynamic resistance increase:**
	+ Insert with spiral groove in bypass 13 and bypass 14.
	+ Coiled pipe design in bypass 15.
	+ Throttling effect to minimize bypass flow.

- **Advantages of the invention:**
	+ Automatic removal of air or gas bubbles.
	+ Relatively simple design and construction.
	+ Smaller outer dimensions for ventilation systems.

- **Potential applications:**
	+ Water-cooled generators with coaxial feed and discharge ducts.

• Description of the Invention:
   • The invention is a self-lubricating, conductive rail car center bowl liner.
   • It is made of ultra high molecular weight polyethylene (UHMW-PE) mixed with 2% carbon black.
   • The carbon black provides conductivity, while the UHMW-PE provides self-lubricating properties.

• Advantages of the Invention:
   • The liner eliminates the need for separate lubricating materials and wet type lubricants.
   • It is resistant to compression, deterioration, and disintegration.
   • The carbon black content increases conductivity under load, providing beneficial effects on the properties of the liner.

• Design Considerations:
   • The liner is designed to withstand loads imposed by cars having a mass bearing on each center bowl.
   • The distance between the carbon black particles decreases as the load on the liner increases, increasing conductivity.
   • The carbon black conductive material is uniformly contained within the UHMW-PE matrix, exposing new carbon black particulates as the matrix wears.

• Liner Configuration:
   • The liner has a dished, bowl-like configuration with a floor or disc portion and an upstanding side wall.
   • The side wall is in circumambient relation about the outer margin of the floor disc portion.
   • The liner is defined by a high density polymer of dry self-lubricating characteristics that is pliable but non-stretchable.

• Applications:

- Invention related to a fluid pressure regulator assembly
- Provides power while regulating fluid pressure
- Reduces variances in output pressure caused by large differences in input pressure
- Inexpensive and lightweight
- Reduces size and cost of regulator needed
- Comprises means for providing a pressurized fluid, transporting it, and regulating it
- Converts pressurized fluid into mechanical power using a vane pump

- Fluid regulator regulates pressure between high-pressure and low-pressure cavities
- Valve stem and diaphragm regulate pressure within low pressure cavity
- Spring and diaphragm maintain pre-determined pressure

- Vane motor translates fluid pressure into mechanical motion

- Inner drum has first and second apertures, first and second vane assemblies, and lost motion linkages

- First lost motion linkage defines interior space with stainless steel drum shaft and guide block
- Drum shaft is coupled to back plate bolted to casing
- Drum shaft extends out of casing and rotates on its own axis

- Fluid enters fluid inlet under pressure, forcing inner drum into counterclockwise rotation
- Vanes move along an abrasion plate while rotating, reducing drag coefficient
- Fluid exhausts through fluid outlet as motor rotates

- Coupled to drive shaft of motor is an electrical generator
- Generator is preferably electric, but may be of any suitable type
- Generator sends electric current to battery for use in driving rotisserie or for any desired function

- Design Challenges of Rotary-Wing Flying Saucer
- * Limited internal space of the saucer shell restricts the structure and layout of the rotary-wing system and its power system
- * Contact and friction between high-speed rotary wing and saucer shell can result in failure or accidents
- * Reactive torque can cause uncontrollable movement
- Solutions to Design Challenges
- * Magnetic suspension radial and axial bearings to suspend rotary wing and avoid contact and friction
- * Magnetic suspension electric engine to reduce noise, vibration, and energy consumption
- * Coaxial axial and radial dual magnetic suspension electromotive rotary wings to overcome reactive torque and enhance power performance
- * Dual rotary-wing systems placed on the same plane to reduce air current disturbance and improve controllability and stability.

• The text describes the invention of streptavidin muteins, which are modified forms of the protein streptavidin with improved binding affinity for certain peptide ligands.

   • The muteins are created through mutations in the region of amino acid positions 44 to 53 of the streptavidin protein. Specifically, the muteins have at least one mutation, such as an amino acid substitution, in this region.

The increase in binding affinity is at least a factor of 5, and preferred muteins have an increase of at least a factor of 10 or 20.

* The invention describes an apparatus and method for continuously electrolytic coloring of aluminum strips or wires.
	+ The apparatus includes means for supplying aluminum strip or wire, anodic oxidation bath, electrolytic coloring bath, electric circuit, and means for passing the aluminum continuously through the baths.
	+ The anodic oxidation bath composition contains sulfuric acid and may further contain a salt, carboxylic acid, organic sulfonic acid, and/or amine.
	+ The thickness of the oxide film formed on an aluminum strip or wire by the anodic oxidation should be thicker than 4 microns.
	+ The aluminum strip or wire having the oxide film formed is then continuously immersed in an electrolytic bath containing at least one of a nickel salt, a cobalt salt, a copper salt, a tin salt, and selenious acid prior to the sealing treatment.
	+ The bath composition for the electrolytic coloring bath is selected suitably from the above-described components depending on the desired color.
	+ The aluminum strip or wire immersed continuously in the electrolytic coloring bath is rendered capable of functioning as a cathode indirectly by the action of the electrode disposed in the bath and is electrolyzed by direct current in the bath.
	+ The current density and the electrolytic period of time in the bath are controlled by the area of the aluminum strip or wire immersed, the amount of electric current applied, and the period of immersion of the aluminum strip or wire.
	+ The apparatus includes a degreasing bath, an etching bath, a current supplying bath, an anodic oxidation bath, an electrolytic coloring bath, and a sealing bath.
	+ The aluminum strip or wire is continuously supplied from a supply roll or a recoiler, passed successively through each bath, and is rolled up or recoiled on a wind-up roll or recoiler.

- **Process of producing transgenic plants or plant cells**
  * At least two different vectors are used, each adapted to recombine with at least one other vector and to integrate the DNA sequence of interest into a chromosome
  * The DNA sequence of interest contains sequence portions from at least two vectors, necessary for expressing a function of interest
  * Plant cells or plants are provided with the vectors, either simultaneously or consecutively but not separated by a cycle of reproduction or regeneration
  * A recombination product containing the DNA sequence of interest is formed within plant cells by site-specific recombination between at least two vectors

- **Site-specific recombination**
  * Each vector is adapted to recombine with at least one other vector, using site-specific recombination sites
  * The reversion of site-specific recombination occurs with low probability, achieved by providing the enzyme for recombination transiently or using an integrase with appropriate recombination sites
  * A gene of a site-specific recombinase or integrase compatible with the selected site-specific recombination sites should be provided for expression
  * The recombination product is non-replicating to avoid disease symptoms

- **Expression of function of interest**

<summary>

* The invention is a swash plate type compressor with a coated swash plate to reduce friction and wear.
* The swash plate is made of non-hypereutectic aluminum or aluminum alloys having less than 10% by weight of silicon.
* A coating is applied to the swash plate by means of liquid spray, comprising a polyfluoro elastomer, a lubricious additive, and a load bearing additive.
* The polyfluoro elastomer is selected from a class of materials that will form highly cross-linked long chain polymers, especially preferred are polyfluoro elastomers of polytetraflouroethylene (PTFE).
* The lubricious additive is selected from a group of materials that provide reduced friction in applications that use little or no oil, such as carbon black, molydisulfide, cesium fluoride, lithium fluoride and mixtures thereof.
* The load bearing additive is selected from a group of materials that provide high hardness and durability in dry conditions, such as boron carbide, boron nitride, oxides of aluminum, oxides of magnesium, spinels of aluminum, spinels of magnesium, silicon carbide, silicon nitride, and mixtures thereof.
* The coating process does not require a high surface finish on the swash plate, rather, it is preferred that the swash plate have a roughened surface to give the coating a mechanism to mechanically attach to the swash plate.
* The coated swash plate exhibits very smooth facial surfaces and end surface, which may eliminate one or more machining step currently used in the manufacture of swash plates.
* The coating is cured at an elevated temperature to form a highly adherent coating with high load bearing and wear resistant properties.
* The coating increases the seizure loads of swash plates with non-hypereutectic aluminum and aluminum alloys having less than 10% by weight of silicon, and performs equal to hypereutectic alloys.

</summary>

• The invention provides a novel process for manufacturing 1,1,1-trifluoroethane (143a) in an economical, industrially feasible manner, based on continuous gas phase hydrofluorination using heterogeneous catalysis.
	• The organic feed is 1,1-difluoro-1-chloroethane (142b) and the fluorinating agent is HF.
	• The process uses a Cr catalyst, which may be unsupported or supported, in the absence or presence of a cocatalyst selected from nickel, cobalt and manganese salts.
	• The process can be carried out at a temperature between 30° C. and 400° C., preferably between 30° and 280° C., more preferably between 100° and 250° C., more preferably between 120° C. and 200° C.
	• Contact time can be varied from 1-100 seconds and is preferably between 5 and 15 seconds.
	• The catalyst has to be activated first using nitrogen, air or HF/142b at a temperature between 100° C. and 650° C., preferably between 200° C. and 500° C.
	• Hydrofluorination can be performed at a pressure between 1 atmosphere (0 psig) and 200 psig, preferably between 1 atmosphere and 150 psig.

* The invention describes a process for spinning bast fibers, such as jute, kenaf, or hemp, into yarn.
    - The process includes health preserving the bast fibers, opening, cleaning, and carding them, then drawing them into bast fiber strips.
    - The bast fiber strips are then health preserved again before spinning them into bast fiber yarn.

* The invention also describes a process for blended spinning bast fibers and other fibers.
    - The process includes health preserving bast fibers, blending them with other fibers, then opening, cleaning, and carding the blended fibers.
    - The carded blended fibers are then drawn into multi-fibre strips, health preserved, and spun into multi-fibre yarn.

* The invention aims to reduce the end breakage rate during the spinning process, thereby improving work efficiency and quality of products.
    - This is achieved through the use of twice health preservation, which increases the flexibility of the bast fibers and improves their spinnability.
    - The experiments conducted in the invention show a significant reduction in the end breakage rate for jute, kenaf, linen, and hemp fibers when using the proposed process.

<summary>
• Nip presses in continuous process industries, particularly in papermaking, use nipped rolls to exert pressing forces on moving webs for forming various materials.
• The present invention provides a method and apparatus for measuring and removing the effects of rotational variability from the nip pressure profile of nip presses with covered rolls having imbedded sensors.
   • Imbedded sensors can detect variations in pressure along the length of the roll but may not compensate for rotational variability generated by high speed rotation.
   • The invention measures and removes rotational variability to obtain a more true profile of the nip pressure being developed in the nip region.
</summary>

• The process of papermaking involves deposition of headbox stock onto a paper machine forming fabric, forming a fibrous web that is supported and advanced through dewatering equipment by the fabric wire.
• One stage of dewatering is passing the web through a pair or more of rotating rolls forming a nip press, during which liquid is expelled from the web via the pressure applied by the rotating rolls.

• Characteristics of nipped rolls are important in papermaking, as the amount of pressure applied to the web during the nip press stage can be critical in achieving uniform sheet characteristics.
• Common problems include lack of uniformity in pressure distribution (nip pressure) along the working length of the roll, which can result in poor quality paper, excessive nip pressure causing crushing or displacement of fibers, and improvements in nip loading leading to higher productivity and lower breakdowns.

• Conventional rolls may have roll deflection due to sag or nip loading and worn roll covers introducing pressure variations.
• Rolls with floating shells and movable surfaces have been developed to compensate for uneven nip pressure distribution.

• Previous techniques for determining discrepancies in nip pressure required stopping the roll and taking a nip impression using carbon paper or pressure sensitive film, or later techniques using mylar with sensing elements to electronically record pressures across the nip.
• These procedures cannot be used while the nip press is in operation and cannot account for temperature, roll speed, or other related changes affecting uniformity of nip pressure.

• Nip presses have been developed to permit the operator to measure the nip pressure while the rolls are being rotated,

<summary>
• First Embodiment
•• Provides a sewing machine with ultrasonic wave receivers to identify a position on a work cloth
••• Receivers are provided on the head of the sewing machine
••• Ultrasonic pen transmits ultrasonic wave when the pen tip touches the work cloth
••• Sewing machine calculates the position of the pen tip based on the time difference between transmission and reception of the ultrasonic wave
••• Sewing machine moves the work cloth to align the calculated position with the needle drop point and starts sewing
• Second Embodiment
•• Uses an embroidery unit with ultrasonic wave receivers instead of the sewing machine
••• Receivers are provided on the carriage of the embroidery unit
••• Embroidery unit moves the work cloth to align the calculated position with the needle drop point and starts sewing
• Third Embodiment
•• Uses an ultrasonic pen with an electromagnetic wave output circuit instead of a signal output circuit
••• Sewing machine detects the electromagnetic wave signal output from the pen to identify the transmission timing of the ultrasonic wave
••• No need for a cable to connect the pen and the sewing machine
• Fourth Embodiment
•• Uses an additional receiver on the pillar of the sewing machine
••• Ultrasonic pen does not have an electromagnetic wave output circuit
••• Sewing machine calculates the position of the pen tip based on the detection timings of the ultrasonic wave by the receivers
••• No need to acquire the transmission timing of the ultrasonic wave
</summary>

• Environmentally friendly and economical

<summary>

• The invention provides a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric or textile material, wherein the preparation comprises a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with the functional additive carried by the wool particles. The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below.

• This preparation has demonstrated exceptional functional additive-carrying and retention ability, enhancing the durability of functional enhancements of a cellulosic fabric material. Using ultrafine wool fibre in such preparations is both environmentally friendly and economical, as wool fibres which are too short and weak to be spun into wool yarns are often scrapped.

• Additionally, the invention provides a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprising a mixture of powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents. The non-charcoal fibrous bamboo powder is preferably nano-sized, having an ultrafine particle size of 1 μm or below. Fabric materials treated with ultrafine bamboo fibre powder have good moisture management properties.

• The invention also provides methods of preparing preparations for application onto cellulosic fabric materials, including pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size and forming an ultrafine wool suspension using the ultrafine wool powder. The method may also include pulverizing the wool powder into a suspension of ultrafine wool particles by ultrasonic crushing.

• The functional additive may include additives for ultraviolet protection, anti-bacteria, or other clothing functions. • Conventional sewing machine detectors have several drawbacks, including the use of curved and difficult-to-machine reflective discs, significant stress on optical fibers due to their curvature, and the possibility of fracturing the optical fiber supporter due to vibration and internal forces.
	• The present invention aims to overcome these disadvantages by providing a low-price, durable detector with a thinner and more compact detecting section, minimizing stress on optical fibers, and including a power indicating light that does not interfere with the detector and controller.
	• The detector according to the preferred embodiment includes flat, sheet-shaped light shielding discs, an optical fiber supporter with linear optical fiber fixing holes, and a power indicating optical fiber that runs from the module section to the detecting section, eliminating interference issues. The first to third light shielding discs are disposed coaxially, with the first disc unrotatably secured and the second and third discs rotatably mounted, allowing for easy angle adjustment and determination.

<summary>
• Energy Dissipation Device for Building Structures
   • Dissipates energy during major dynamic events
   • Limits loads transmitted to difficult-to-repair parts of structures
   • May undergo plastic deformation to protect structure integrity
• Prior Art Comparison of Building Responses
   • Concrete shear wall vs moment-resistant frame in Managua earthquake
   • Ductile system providing reliable method against catastrophic failure
   • Moment-resistant frame building suffered extensive damage and abandoned
• Proposed Structural Systems
   • Beneficial inelastic action during seismic response
   • Increased bending stresses and plastic hinges in braced frame building
   • Hydraulic dampers at strategic locations for controlled energy dissipation
</summary>

The text describes an energy dissipation device for building structures, highlighting its ability to dissipate energy during major dynamic events and limit loads transmitted to difficult-to-repair parts of structures. The device may undergo plastic deformation to protect structure integrity. A comparison of building responses during the Managua earthquake is provided, contrasting the performance of a concrete shear wall and a moment-resistant frame. The text also discusses proposed structural systems, including beneficial inelastic action during seismic response, increased bending stresses and plastic hinges in braced frame buildings, and hydraulic dampers at strategic locations for controlled energy dissipation.

- Pulsed Power Device and Method of Using for EOR
  * Pulsed power is the rapid release of electrical energy stored in capacitor banks
  * Can be used in a direct plasma mode or by discharging energy through a coil to generate a short-lived but intense magnetic field
- Limitations of Direct Acoustic Stimulation and Solution
  * Natural attenuation properties of reservoir absorb high frequencies and reduce effective frequency range
  * Pulsed power method can generate high-frequency acoustic stimulation of the reservoir separately from the direct acoustic response of the EH shock wave
  * Electromagnetic pulse induces a coupled acoustic vibration at very high frequencies in geologic materials like quartz, causing stimulation at multiple scales in the reservoir body
  * This induced acoustic vibration acts for a short period of time after the pulse is discharged, but is not limited by the natural acoustic attenuation that limits the effectiveness of a direct acoustic pulse source

- Construction of the lock device
  * The lock device includes a lock pin, a lock plate with a hook part and a slot, and a guide member to keep the lock plate at a prescribed position.
  * The lock pin is provided in the boom bracket of the vehicle, and the lock plate is attached to the side surface of the boom.
  * The guide member is formed by bending a plate L-like shaped when viewed in rear, and is fixed to the side surface of the support pin at the side of basal part of the boom.
- Operation of the lock device
  * The lock plate can be rotated vertically between the lock position and the release position, and the angle of the lock plate is regulated by the guide member in cooperation with the rearward-slanted surface and the rear upper surface of the lock plate.
  * When the lock plate is slid forward to the lock position, the lock pin is engaged therewith and the rear portion of the rearward-slanted surface touches the lower surface of the guide member so as to prevent further downward rotation of the lock plate.
  * When the boom is rotated to the foremost position while the lock plate is projected, the lock pin moved from the forward-slanted surface reaches the hook part of the lock plate so that the lock plate is engaged with the lock pin so as to be locked.
- Advantages of the lock device
  * The lock device can prevent the boom from being unexpectedly rotated forward by vibration, leak of operating oil or the like.
  * The lock plate is prevented from being stretched against the guide member and damaged when the boom is rotated forward so as to be locked at the time of finishing the work.
  * The lock plate is rotated rearward by the weight thereof centering on the support pin and slid downward so as to reach the release position automatically when the boom is rotated to the lowest position.
- Applicability of the lock device
  * The lock device is adoptable for locking a boom, an arm or the like in the state of stored in a main body, and is available in an excavating device, a loader, a crane and the like.

- Overview of the Invention
  * Provides a solution for retrieving wear bushings in oil well drilling tools and apparatuses
  * Allows for retrieval without the use of a drill bit
  * Consists of a sub-unit that can be mounted onto a drill string
  * Includes a retriever section for engaging with the wear bushing

- Background and Prior Art
  * Wear sleeves or bushings are used to protect against excessive wear in oil and gas well drilling
  * Previous methods for retrieving wear sleeves include using a J-slot and a retriever body with outwardly protruding dowels
  * These methods require the retriever body to be secured in rigid engagement with the exterior of the pipe

- Present Invention
  * The apparatus of the present invention allows for vertical movement of the retriever unit but not rotational movement
  * The retriever unit can be mounted onto a mandrel and connected onto drill pipe, allowing for vertical play to prevent damage
  * The apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole
  * The retriever unit can be easily removed and installed for quickly removing the wear bushing during the drilling operation

- Additional Embodiment
  * An additional embodiment of the retriever apparatus includes a retriever section with a threaded lower end section for retrieving a particular type of wear bushing with a threaded collar section
  * The retriever section would threadably engage the female end of the wear bushing, allowing for the drill string to be lifted out of the hole and the wear bushing to be retrieved in the process.

• Advantages of the vibratory tool:
  • Allows a wireline or other tools to pass through a central passage, which can be closed by landing a plug on a seat
  • Dump valve is disposed annularly about the central passage to prevent it from being slammed against a seat during cycling
  • Modular piston stack increases the delivered power of the tool
  • Tool can deliver high amplitude low frequency oscillating forces to the stuck fish without impacts
  • Optional rotational lock between the mandrel and the housing for torque transmission

• Design of the tool:
  • Outer body with a lower end attached to a stuck object or fish
  • Mandrel extending uphole from the upper end of the outer body, connected to the surface through a string
  • Mandrel has a passage in fluid communication with the passage in the string so that pressure can be delivered to lateral ports
  • Pressure in the annular space pushes down the piston and with it the mandrel, displacing fluid from the chamber through an opening
  • Stacking pistons connected to the mandrel increases the area of total pistons exposed to the applied pressure, increasing the delivered power of the tool
</summary>

The tool has an outer body with a lower end that is attached to a stuck object or fish. The outer body has an upper end. Within the outer body and extending uphole from the upper end is the mandrel. The mandrel is connected to the surface through a string. The mandrel has a passage that is in fluid communication with the passage in the string so that pressure can be delivered from the surface to lateral ports. Ports are at different elevations. A row of ports leads to an annular space with which there is communication to a piston that is attached to the mandrel. Pressure in the space pushed down the piston and with it the mandrel at the same time displacing fluid from the chamber through an opening. Stacking pistons in effect increases the area of total pistons exposed to the applied pressure thus increasing the delivered power of the tool to considerably more than had been available in prior art tools.

• Method for manufacturing composed stave floors
    • Provides a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm
    • Provides a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm
    • Assembles both substrates together with glue and multidirectional holding means
• Improved properties of composed stave floors
    • Preserves physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of sight substrate
    • Prevents deformation of sight substrate
    • Prevents displacement or change of dimensions of both sheets
    • Increases useful life of floors and allows corrective maintenance
    • Provides improved bonding means between both sheets

The method for manufacturing composed stave floors includes providing a sight substrate with a thickness of at least 4 mm and a base substrate with a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane. The improved properties of composed stave floors include preserving the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of the sight substrate, preventing deformation of the sight substrate, preventing displacement or change of dimensions of both sheets, increasing the useful life of the floors and allowing corrective maintenance, providing improved bonding means between both sheets, and eliminating the time and inconvenience of applying the glaze during installation.

- Position sensor with waveform generator and error correction generator
  * Waveform generator receives unconditioned sensing signal from transducer and modifies it based on error correction signal
  * Error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals
  * Comparator receives conditioned sensing signal and determines its value
  * Controller provides first and second timing signals based on value of conditioned sensing signal
  * Signal processor provides error correction signal based on timing signals
- Window reference circuit constantly compares ideal sensor output to existing sensor output and adjusts output if it is above or below preset reference signals
  * Signal processor generates small reference signal to eliminate small values of drift in negative going direction
  * Error correction generator generates large reference signal to allow rapid recalibration due to sudden changes in offset voltage
  * DAC and counter combination circuit contains enough resolution to prevent error correction signal from becoming significant portion of conditioned sensing signal
- Sensor monitoring system remotely located and provides power to sensor and receives conditioned sensing signal via two wires
- Comparators, voltage divider network, and controller form window comparator
  * Voltage divider network provides reference voltages to negative pins of comparators
  * Comparator references set high and low ends of window
  * Window comparator input below window causes counter to count down at high rate
  * Counter counts down at low rate when window comparator input is inside window from below
- Upon rapid increase in sensor voltage on power-up, preset generates pulse causing counter and DAC outputs to go to highest value and output of differential amplifier to go to zero
- Low end of window set by resistors is just high enough in value to compensate for any offset in comparator
- Logic operates to force counter to count down rapidly and output of differential amplifier to rise when input to window comparator is below preselected window
- When sensor system baseline is in desired position, high end of window generated by resistor network is significantly higher in value than normal dynamic signal
- Components of sensor operate to begin increasing output of DAC in order to compensate for increase in value as object or process being monitored increases output of differential amplifier
- DAC and counter combination contain enough resolution to prevent error correction signal from becoming significant portion of sensor position signal.

• Operation principles
   • Conventional hog fuel burners use excess air for complete combustion, leading to high temperatures and slag formation.
   • The invention burns below stoichiometric proportions in the primary chamber and with 20% excess air in the secondary chamber, maintaining temperatures below 1600° F.

• Burner design
   • A conical pile of fuel is formed and preheated underfire air is introduced from below to gasify the fuel.
   • High pressure swirl air is introduced tangentially in the primary combustion chamber, driving heavier particles to the outer wall while allowing volatile gases to pass through.

• Control and advantages
   • The quantity of high pressure swirl air is adjusted based on primary chamber exit temperature.
   • The invention offers quick response time, low clinker/slag formation, long refractory life, and fuel of variable size and moisture content.
   • Clean discharge gases can be directly supplied to the boiler or mixed with additional air for other industrial uses.

• The Small Arms Firing Effect Simulator (SAFES) is an electronically controlled pyrotechnic sound and flash simulator for use with small arms training.

• The expendable contains a plurality of rounds and is installed in a firing unit which can be inserted into the weapon via the magazine breech.
• The invention produces sound and flash by the electrical ignition of the pyrotechnic in a confined space and venting the combustion produced in a manner which utilizes the weapon's ejection port.
• The electrical control circuit provides for automatic and semiautomatic fire, and interfaces with the weapon trigger and bolt.

	• The circuitry of the SAFES consists of ten functional blocks, plus battery and expendable.
	• It utilizes seven CMOS IC's, thirty-one SCR's, five diodes, six capacitors, seventy-four resistors, and three switches.

• The invention describes a method and arrangement for compressing and cooling natural gas in a compressor station for a gas pipeline, particularly in permanent frost areas.

• The gas is compressed to a higher pressure, cooled by heat exchange, and then fed back into the pipeline with an increased exit pressure and a lower exit temperature, typically at most 0° C.

• The cooling process poses problems during the transition periods and summer months due to high outside temperatures. Conventional re-cooling plants with separate cooling cycles are used during these warm weather periods, but they are expensive, unused for most of the year, and pose safety risks due to the use of flammable and heavier-than-air cooling agents like propane.

• The invention aims to reduce investments and operation risks by compressing the gas to a substantially higher pressure (excess pressure) than the desired exit pressure, cooling the compressed gas by heat exchange to a temperature above the exit temperature, and then obtaining further cooling to the desired exit temperature by expanding the gas from the excess pressure to the desired exit pressure.

• The compressor station includes at least one compressor, at least one heat exchanger, valve-controlled pipelines, and control units. An electronic control is provided to control the compressor and valves, compressing the gas to an excess pressure and expanding the compressed gas to the desired exit pressure.

• The invention utilizes the physical effect that a compressed gas is inevitably cooled when expanded to a lower pressure. This cooling effect is sufficient to obtain the desired exit temperature during the warmer period of the year.

• The expansion can be carried out by a valve or an expansion turbine, which can recover mechanical energy and utilize it for providing a portion of the drive energy for the compression of the gas to the intended excess pressure.

- The invention describes a rolling body guide cage and a method for manufacturing it.
  * The guide cage is made from at least one ring element and several guide structures for rolling bodies arranged in a circular pattern.
  * The ring element is produced from a sheet metal material with an axial profiling formed by forming techniques.
- The ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together in a production step before the formation of the axial profiling.
  * This allows for a significant reduction in cutting waste during manufacturing.
  * The flat material ring segments are welded together in the engagement zone, forming an undercut geometry that preliminarily couples the segments together.
- The flat material ring segments are punched out from a sheet metal material, preferably as 120° segments.
  * This allows for a high material saving, as only three weld points are required for joining together a ring element.
  * The 120° segments can be punched out in close succession from a sheet metal strip, allowing for efficient manufacturing.
- The invention is suitable for the manufacture of radial and axial bearing cages, including cages for groove and angular ball bearings.
  * In the case of groove and angular ball bearings, the rolling body guide cage can be composed of a first and second ring element arranged in mirror-symmetry.
  * The weld points between the ring segments of the ring elements are preferably offset with respect to one another in the circumferential direction.
- The method for manufacturing the rolling body guide cage involves a forming step to give the ring element an axial profiling and several rolling body guide structures.
  * Prior to the forming step, the ring element is composed of at least two flat material ring segments joined together in the circumferential direction.
  * The flat material ring segments are welded together in a joint formed by the segments.
- The formation of the weld point can be performed by laser welding or pressure welding.
  * Local accumulations of material can be retained in the region of the weld point, formed by bead portions generated during punching out the ring elements.
  * The ring segments can be produced with a slight oversize and further cut and calibrated after welding, or cut to their final dimensions before forming.

• Introduction of a method for investigating a sample derived from a biological source using CARS microscopy
• Aim is to furnish a correspondingly improved method for CARS microscopy
• The method comprises furnishing at least one resonance site by means of a bioorthogonal reaction of an intrinsic chemical structure of the sample with at least one reaction partner
• A bioorthogonal reaction is a chemical reaction that can proceed in living systems without appreciably interfering with natural processes
• The invention is based on the use of bioorthogonal chemical reactions
• The method allows dedicated detection of target sites in any samples, for example in cells, without negatively affecting biochemical processes

• The text describes a system and method for assessing the quality of medical segmentations, such as those used in radiation therapy.
• The system uses electronic files, such as those in the DICOM-RT standard, to store segmentations or "regions of interest" (ROIs).
• The system converts the segmentations into volume models and compares them to identify missing or extra volume elements.
• The comparison results can be used for various purposes, such as training clinicians, evaluating autosegmentation routines, and quality assurance.
• The system can also compare segmentations from different sources, such as different clinicians or software systems.
• The system can display the comparison results in various ways, such as by color-coding the common, missing, and extra volume elements.
• The system can also display the comparison results superimposed on the original medical images used for the segmentation.
• The system uses a metric method to measure the conformance between the segmentations, which can be customized by the user.
• The metric method can be based on simple parameters associated with constant, linear, and exponential functions.
• The system can also provide a histogram showing the distribution of missing and extra volume elements according to distance ranges.

• The text describes a method and apparatus for accelerating the execution of floating point operations in data processing systems.
• The invention is related to two patent applications for executing floating point operations and accelerating floating point addition and subtraction operations.
• The background of the invention explains the use of floating point format in data processing systems and the complexity of addition and subtraction operations in this format.
• The invention aims to accelerate the effective subtraction operation in a floating point unit.
• The invention features the use of a difference between a subset of signals of the operand exponent arguments to accelerate the effective subtraction operation.
• The invention also features beginning the effective subtraction procedure based on the difference between a subset of operand exponent argument signals prior to the availability of the complete difference between the exponent arguments.
• The invention includes a floating point execution that includes apparatus for determining the difference between operand exponential arguments and apparatus for determining the difference between a subset of the operand exponent arguments.
• The subset difference apparatus provides a result prior to a determination of the complete difference between the operand exponent arguments.
• The subset difference is used to begin subtraction of differences between operand fractions (or fractional portions thereof).

• The invention divides the effective subtraction operation into two procedures based on the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents of the two operands.
- When the absolute value of the difference in the arguments of the exponents (ABS{DELTA(E)}) is greater than one, the larger operand is identified, and the subtraction operation is performed to ensure a positive resultant quantity.
- The normalization and rounding operation are combined into a single time-consuming step, reducing the number of steps required.
- When ABS{DELTA(E)} is less than or equal to one, the alignment of the fractions is performed without requiring a separate step, and either the normalization step or the rounding step is required, but not both.

• The invention uses the difference between the least significant position subset of the operand exponent argument to initiate the operation involving the operand fractions.
- When TDELTA(E)=0, the operation for determining FRACTION A - FRACTION B is begun.
- When TDELTA(E)=1, the computation of the final fraction result FRACTION A - F

- Device for measuring distances on a golf course
  - Uses GPS technology and voice recognition technology
  - Provides distance and other information to user in verbal form
- Additional features
  - Memorizes and computes user data to predict golf strategy and club selection
  - Can be used for other applications such as hiking, surveying, and hunting
  - May be connected to a separate personal computer for various detailed functions

</summary>

This invention generally relates to a voice activated distance measuring device, such as for providing distance and other information to a golfer. The device uses voice recognition technology and GPS technology to provide a user, such as a golfer, with required data on the golf course and its parameters in a verbal electronically spoken form. The electronics and software for this device may be incorporated into an article of clothing, or other portable device, such as an article of headgear, including a golf hat or visor. The device may alternatively use distance measuring technology such as infra red, optics, Doppler acoustics and the like. The device uses commercially available GPS data, such as supplied by Sports Mapping, Inc., or similar company, providing golf course mapping data to convert GPS mapped longitude and latitude coordinates to measure distance and other factors. The device may also accept verbal or any other data input and memorize and compute this, when prompted by voice command or an electrical pulse generated by touch or remote control, to predict golf course user golf strategy, club selection, rules and other golf player needs. The device may be used for other applications, such as hiking, surveyors and hunters and other applications. The device may also be connected to a separate personal computer or similar technology provided by the user of this device for various detailed functions.

• The invention relates to a method and apparatus for testing squirrel cage rotors of dynamoelectric machines, such as electric motors and generators.
• 
• The objective is to non-destructively test rotors for defects by obtaining resistance, reactance, and effective electrical skew measurements.
• 
• The apparatus includes a test head with an exciting means to magnetize the rotor during relative angular movement, voltage sensing means to generate a voltage signal, current sensing means to sense the magnetizing current, and processing means to determine resistance and reactance.
• 
• Optionally, skew sensing means may be included to sense the effective electrical skew and determine an effective electrical skew of the rotor.
• 
• The apparatus is used in conjunction with a data acquisition, processing, and control system, which controls testing and acquires data from each test head independently.
• 
• The test heads have a unique construction, comprising a core of magnetic material and a set of primary windings that form at least one pair of poles. The rotor is positioned within the center cavity and rotated, inducing voltages and generating magnetic flux.
• 
• The pick-up coil senses the induced voltage, while the skew pick-up coil senses flux build-up at the end of the rotor due to skew characteristics. The skew pick-up coil is positioned in quadrature with the poles and at the end of the core.

- Mobile Device Security
  - Closed mobile devices protect software by scrutinizing code prior to commercialization and coding software to prevent third-party code execution.
  - Open mobile devices allow third-party applications to execute, requiring an arbitration layer to ensure managed applications are not given the same level of trust as trusted software.
- Managed Libraries and Applications
  - Managed libraries are granted access to native resources by validating a digital certificate associated with the managed library.
  - Managed applications are denied access to native resources through a managed library, and can be terminated if they attempt to access such resources.
- Digital Signatures and Certificates
  - Digital signatures are used to authenticate the runtime host, manager, managed library, and managed application.
  - Certificates associated with managed applications can identify them as trusted or un-trusted, and list managed libraries that the application can call.

- Implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment
  * Functional memory updates are made by copying the path from the root to the point of updating and modifying the copy
  * Overwrite memory environments directly modify the original data
  * A double-ended list is typically used to implement a FIFO queue in overwrite memory environments
- Tree-shaped data structure for implementing a FIFO queue in a functional memory environment
  * Nodes have a given maximum size
  * Additions are directed to the first non-full node on the first edge of the tree
  * Deletions are directed to a leaf node on the edge of the tree, typically on the opposite edge
  * Leaf nodes remain at the same hierarchy level, and new nodes are created if necessary
- Performance improvements with the tree-shaped data structure
  * Each update requires a time and space that are logarithmically dependent on the length of the queue
  * The node to be updated is easy to access by following the edge of the tree until a leaf node is found
- Additional features of the invention
  * A separate header node can be used to improve performance and enable inversion of the queue
  * The queue can be inverted in constant time and space by changing the value of the identifier in the header node
  * The tree structure can be interpreted as a mirror image to enable additions and deletions from both ends of the queue (deque)

• Advantages of the EPROM devices of the present invention:

- The invention is about a zoom lens with increased relative aperture, good optical performance, and reduced size for photographic or video cameras.
  * The lens has a high relative aperture and high range, while still maintaining high grade optical performance.
  * The size of the lens is minimized, with a short total length suitable for cameras.
- The invention addresses the challenge of increasing the relative aperture while reducing the size of the lens, which typically results in poor optical performance.
  * This is especially important for video cameras, which require a high relative aperture due to their low-sensitivity image pickup elements.
- The invention is particularly useful for 8mm video cameras, which are becoming more popular due to their compactness and high manageability.
  * These cameras use a 2/3 inch image pickup tube, which is being reduced in size to a 1/2 inch image pickup tube.
- The invention uses a 4-unit lens design, with the fourth unit stationary during zooming and the fifth unit correcting residual aberrations.
  * The front lens unit is designed to reduce the size of the entire lens system while maintaining the prescribed optical performance.
- The invention avoids increasing the spherical aberration, coma, and higher order aberrations that typically result from increasing the refractive power of each lens unit.
  * This is achieved by setting forth proper design rules for the image forming section.
- The invention reduces the total length of the lens system to shorter than 10φ A, which has been difficult to achieve while maintaining good optical performance throughout the zooming range.
  * This is achieved by satisfying certain conditions related to the focal length, radius of curvature, Abbe number, and refractive power of the lens units.
- The invention also satisfies a condition to minimize the variation of aberrations with zooming.
  * This is achieved by controlling the refractive power of the second lens unit.
- The invention improves aberration correction by constructing the fourth and fifth lens units in a specific way.
  * The fourth lens unit is a bi-convex lens with a rear surface of strong curvature, and the fifth lens unit comprises six lenses with specific curvatures and refractive indices.

- The invention relates to a method and device for detecting elementary particles, such as protons, ions, electrons, neutrons, or photons, in a detector.
  - A charge pulse is generated in the detector when a particle passes through it, and every charge pulse is converted into an electric signal and indicated and/or recorded.
  - Individual signals are amplified in a first, fast amplifier, and a plurality of signals are integrated in a second, slow amplifier.
- The prior art typically integrates a plurality of signals at high frequencies or signal rates, which can only be adapted to count or signal rates to be expected in exceptional cases.
  - It is not possible to both detect individual particles and their sequences or pulses over time and use an integration of particles when exceeding a count rate or signal rate in order to maintain a result averaged over an extended period of time.
- The invention aims to provide a method and device that enable both a measurement or detection of individual particles and an integration of count rates, in particular upon exceeding of a given threshold value for signal rates, as a function of such signal rates or desired boundary conditions.
  - This allows for a reliable detection or evaluation of small-size signals.
- The invention proposes discharging of a charge pulse or signal from the detector on the low-voltage side.
  - This enables the detection of signals or pulses generated by elementary particles irrespective of a previous restriction as required in the prior art in respect to a possible detection of individual particles or an integration of the same.
- The invention proposes that, as a function of the rate of the electric signals, individual signals are amplified in the first, fast amplifier and signals are integrated in the second, slow amplifier at least upon exceeding of a threshold value of the rate of the signals.
  - This allows for the measuring or detecting of individual particles at low rates or frequencies, while enabling the integration of each of a plurality of signals from at least a threshold value or limit value.
- The invention proposes that the signals are separated as a function of the rate by a capacitor preceding at least a first amplifier for amplifying individual low-rate signals, or a high-pass element, and/or by an inductive element preceding at least a second amplifier for amplifying high-rate signals, or a low-pass element.

• Automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies
• Includes a test enclosure with a stationary and movable ring
• Driven disc assembly is installed between the rings and frictionally engaged
• Torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly
• Position sensor measures the distance between the rings
• Servo motor moves the movable ring to reduce frictional force
• Microprocessor controls the process and determines if the warpage is within tolerances
• External indications are given to the operator regarding the condition of the tested assembly

• Operation:
• Driven disc assembly is installed on the hub
• Servo motor rapidly moves the movable ring to frictionally engage the driven disc assembly
• Position sensor measures the distance between the rings
• Torque motor exerts a predetermined torque on the driven disc assembly
• Servo motor gradually moves the movable ring to reduce frictional force
• Microprocessor measures the rotation and distance of the driven disc assembly
• Difference signal is compared with a standard value to determine if the warpage is within tolerances
• External indications are given to the operator regarding the condition of the tested assembly

</summary>

Note: The above summary is based on the provided text and is intended to highlight the main features and operation of the automatic spin checking apparatus for driven disc assemblies. It is not intended to replace or supersede the information provided in the text.

* Face age-estimation is a challenging task in computer vision due to large variations in human faces
  * Accurate age-estimation can be beneficial in various real-world scenarios such as automated control and surveillance systems, homeland security technologies, criminal identification, and management of e-documents and electronic customer relationships
  * Aging of human faces is influenced by various factors such as gender, ethnicity, heredity, and environmental factors
  * Computer science approaches for aging problems are relatively new and generally address two areas: face age-estimation and face age-progression
  * Extracting unique information from each image and using it in an exhaustive comparison can lead to an accurate, efficient, uncooperative, and cost-effective solution to face age-estimation, but these methods are known to be computationally expensive
  * The present invention is directed to face age-estimation and methods, systems, and software therefor
  * The invention includes a method of generating a face age-estimation for a face represented by first image data as a function of faces represented by second image data and having assigned landmark points and known ages
  * The method involves receiving first image data, applying a contourlet appearance model (CAM) algorithm to generate a first feature vector, executing an age classifier on the first feature vector to identify an estimated age group, and applying an aging function to the first feature vector to generate the face age-estimation
  * The invention also includes a method of face age-estimation that involves extracting facial features from an image of a test subject and mapping the facial features to one of at least two differing age groups having corresponding differently calibrated mapping functions
  * The methods and systems of the present invention can help improve the accuracy and efficiency of face age-estimation in various applications.

• The invention is about locating and tracing concealed elongated conductive objects such as pipes or cables, especially when another object is adjacent to the first.
• The prior art has two general techniques: a passive technique using a gradiometer to detect ferrous metal objects, and an active technique using a transmitter to induce alternating currents in non-ferrous metal pipes or cables and a receiver to sense magnetic fields associated with the currents.
• The invention provides a system and method that improves the ease and accuracy of locating and tracing one concealed object in the presence of an adjacent object.
• The system comprises a transmitter with means including a pair of antennae for inducing a pair of distinguishable alternating currents in the objects, and a receiver with means for sensing magnetic fields associated with the currents and producing an output signal dependent upon the sensing of both fields.
• The method involves producing in the objects a pair of distinguishable alternating currents, moving a receiver sensitive to the magnetic fields associated with the currents, and producing an output signal from the receiver dependent upon the sensing of both fields.
• The transmitter has a pair of antennae that generate corresponding magnetic fields, which induce distinguishable currents in cables.
• The transmitting apparatus is optimally positioned relative to the cables to produce two distinct output signal nulls over the respective cables.
• The system can locate and trace one of the cables more easily and accurately than with prior art systems and methods.
• The invention can distinguish the currents in the respective cables and produce an output signal dependent upon the presence of both currents using different carrier frequencies, amplitude-modulated frequencies, or pulsed repetition rates.
</summary>

• Invention related to multimedia communications for handling multimedia calls with legacy phones and services
• Two approaches for integrated multimedia services: replacing equipment or integrating multimedia capabilities with circuit switched calls
• Present invention provides a solution in the packet domain for integrating voice calls with multimedia sessions as a blended call
• Blended call has a single session with voice and multimedia components, managed by blender software or hardware
• Incoming call from a remote caller is directed to a multimedia server with blender software if the recipient has blended capabilities
• Outgoing call from a user with blended capabilities is processed at the telephony server and referred to a blender function on the multimedia server
• Well suited for use with a Session Initiation Protocol for Telephones (SIP-T) configuration

<summary>

- The invention describes a content synchronization framework for connected devices.
  * The framework includes a central reference point, servers hosting files, network connectivity, and external partners.
- The client shares contextual information with the central reference point via a synchronization request.
  * The context includes dynamic attributes such as device location, type, and arbitrary attribute values.
- The central reference point verifies the request, compiles bundle information based on the request attributes, and composes a response made up of zero or more bundles.
  * The bundles describe location and properties of content types such as executable files, libraries, or any data type.
- The client composes a delta list of all the files in the bundle that are different from local copies available to the client device.
  * The delta list is comprised of files not locally available to the client device or for which a bundle provides a newer version.
- The client retrieves the files in the ordered delta list from various servers indicated in the bundles.
  * The files downloaded are also compressed to save download time over slow and/or low bandwidth connections.
- The present systems and methods preferably employ data compression for responses to save bandwidth and time over low bandwidth connections.
  * Reducing the size of data files transmitted allows faster communication between the central reference point and client device even over a standard telephone dial-up connection.
- The client device preferably synchronizes to the content determined by a central reference point.
  * The present framework preferably supports both synchronous and asynchronous interaction between the central reference point and connected devices or appliances.
- The present invention is highly scalable, preferably due to the client device performing a major portion of processing.
  * The present framework preferably supports multiple languages and character sets from a central reference point and distributed content servers.
- The present synchronization framework provides a central reference point, such as a server or group of servers, and each communicating device, preferably synchronizes to the content determined by this central reference point.
  * The present invention is also preferably deployable worldwide with support for multiple languages and character sets from a central reference point and distributed content servers.

- The foil electron multiplier is a new type of electron multiplier that uses a series of thin foils to amplify electrons in a series of transmission stages.
- It can be used for amplification of an incident electron flux or for detection of particles such as photons, ions, and electrons.
- The foil electron multiplier comprises a series of thin foils held by foil holders in an evacuated enclosure that form discrete multiplication stages.
- Voltage is applied to each foil, so that secondary electrons created by incident particle are accelerated in a direction from first stage of the multiplier through last stage and collected onto an anode.
- The gain of a foil electron multiplier is maximized by maximizing the electron transmission of electrons through the foil, maximizing the transmission through the support grid, and maximizing the secondary electron emission yield.
- The gain advantage of the foil electron multiplier over conventional multipliers lies in the term γ SE +1, which represents the secondary electron yield from a primary electron exiting a foil and the continuation of the primary electron with the secondaries that it produces.
- Ion feedback, which is important primarily for continuous electron multipliers, is not experienced by the foil electron multiplier.
- The range of foil dimensions practiced for the present invention is from about 0.5 cm diameter (round) to 2×4 cm 2 (rectangular), and the foil areal thickness can range from about 0.2 μg/cm 2 to about 2 μg/cm 2.
- A support grid attached to the foil holder and spanning the aperture is required for a foil areal thickness of 0.2 to 1 μg/cm 2.

<summary>

• Dicing of semiconductor devices using pressure to mechanically separate the individual die from the wafer

• Process involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer and then applying a mechanical pressure to the semiconductor wafer

• Mechanical pressure causes a "clean break" of the wafer along the scribe lines, thereby singulating individual die on the wafer

• Apparatus includes a pad for supporting a semiconductor wafer, a positioning member to position the semiconductor wafer on the pad, and a pressure mechanism to apply a mechanical pressure to the wafer so as to singulate the individual die on the wafer

</summary>

• Dicing process using pressure instead of a wafer saw

• Involves forming trenches along the scribe lines on a semiconductor wafer

• Mechanical pressure applied to the semiconductor wafer causes a "clean break" along the scribe lines, singulating individual die

• Apparatus includes:

• Pad for supporting a semiconductor wafer

• Positioning member to position the semiconductor wafer on the pad

• Pressure mechanism to apply a mechanical pressure to the wafer and singulate the individual die

• Process flow:

• Fabricate circuitry and metallization on the active surface of the wafer

• Apply photo resist layer on the active surface and pattern it to form openings along the scribe lines

• Etch trenches in the openings along the scribe lines

• Place adhesive tape on the back-surface of the wafer

• Apply pressure to the back surface causing the wafer to break along the trenches, singulating the dice from the wafer

• Can be used for any sized wafer or any type of die

• Trenches can be formed by partially cutting the wafer using a wafer saw or on the bottom surface of the wafer.

- Field Emission Display (FED) devices
  * FEDs use electrons to excite phosphors and produce images
  * FEDs have advantages over LCDs, such as higher contrast ratio, larger viewing angle, and lower power consumption
- Issues with FED devices
  * Ionized gases can cause electrical surges and damage to field emission elements
  * Conventional FED devices use spacers to prevent collapse of glass panels and maintain proper spacing
- Protection structure for FED devices
  * Reduction plates or electrodes alter the discharge path of ionized gases and prevent electrical surges
  * Multiple reduction plates or electrodes can be used to intersperse among field emission elements and prolong the lifetime of the device
- Embodiments of the protection structure
  * Elongated reduction plates or electrodes arranged parallel and adjacent to rows of field emission elements
  * Reduction plates or electrodes arranged in a meshwork- or net-shaped pattern among the field emission elements
- Operation of the protection structure
  * A negative voltage is applied to the reduction plate or plates to attract positive nitrogen and oxygen ions
  * The ions are prevented from contacting the cathode and inducing surging of an excessive electrical current to the cathode and field emission elements.

* **Image Sensor with Multiple Imaging Planes**
	+ P-type substrate with major and edge surfaces
	+ Three image sensors formed in the substrate
	+ Each image sensor includes an image sensing region and a charge collecting and transfer means
	+ P+ layers formed between the image sensors and substrate edges to guide charge carriers
	+ Three imaging planes: one on a top surface, and two on edge surfaces
* **Charge Carrier Movement**
	+ Photons impinging on imaging planes generate charge carriers
	+ Charge carriers guided toward the CCDs by the P+ layers
	+ Carriers diffuse laterally and collected as signal charge in CCD storage regions
	+ Charge carriers transferred to CCDs by voltages supplied to transfer gates

	+ Increases lateral extent of depletion region and improves charge collection
* **Mounting Arrangement**
