• Kirsty Williams, Minister for Education in Wales, and Steve Davies, Director of Education, discuss the use of powers under the School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013 and the role of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) in the Welsh Government's school improvement journey.
	• The OECD has been involved in reviewing the state of Welsh education and will publish its latest report on Welsh education on 23 March 2020. The report will evaluate the progress of the Welsh Government's national mission and the self-evaluation of the entire system.
	• Local authorities have powers of intervention in schools if they feel it is necessary. The types of interventions include appointing additional governors, suspending a school's delegated budget, or applying to replace a governing body with an intervention board.
	• The Welsh Government has not used its powers to date, but encourages local authorities to take a proactive approach to intervention.
	• The national evaluation and improvement resource has been developed to promote self-evaluation in schools. The resource is being tested and evaluated, with the intention of introducing it across the system in September 2020.
	• The resource is being developed in co-construction with the OECD, middle tier, and practitioners to ensure that it is practical and usable in schools. The external perception of the resource is important, and it is not intended to be a checklist exercise.

• The Welsh Government has asked the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) to review the progress of the Welsh education system against the national mission.
		• The OECD review is part of the Welsh Government's ongoing development of self-evaluation, aiming to avoid accepting their own orthodoxy and to have an external verification of where they are.
		• The OECD was able to talk to whoever they felt it was important to talk to, including practitioners on the ground, elements of the middle tier, as well as Welsh Government.
		• The reports of the Senedd itself have also been looked at by the OECD, examining how the Senedd has contributed to and has held the Government to account.

* The Welsh Government has asked the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development (OECD) to review the progress of Welsh education against the national mission
  * The OECD review is part of the Welsh Government's ongoing development of self-evaluation, to ensure that they are constantly testing themselves and not just accepting their own orthodoxy
  * The School Standards and Organisation (Wales) Act 2013 gives local authorities extensive powers of intervention in schools, but the use of these powers varies across local authorities
  * The national evaluation and improvement resource is being developed to promote robust self-evaluation in schools, and is being tested in phase 2 with the aim of introducing it across the system in September 2020
  * The resource is being developed in co-construction with the OECD, middle tier, practitioners, and Estyn, to ensure that it is usable and meaningful in schools
  * The investment in school standards has been significant in this Assembly term, with 50% of the money going directly to supporting the professional learning of those who work with children
  * The school categorisation system is used to identify schools that need support, and is evolving to align with the curriculum reform and changes in self-evaluation
  * The categorisation system is primarily a triage system to identify risk and align support, rather than an accountability system
  * The Chief Inspector has raised concerns about schools not being identified early enough, particularly in secondary schools, and the Welsh Government is addressing this by looking at different sets of data and piloting a new multi-agency approach to support improvement in schools causing concern.

- In Berlin, two CIA agents are abducted and a group called The Covenant claims responsibility.
  * The agents, Klein and Rotter, were working undercover at Laszig Aerospace.
  * The Covenant is a loose affiliation of Russian Nationalists and retired KGB members.
- Sydney wants to go to Munich to retrieve a package from The Covenant as part of a trade to free the remaining agent.
  * Dixon would rather send Weiss and have Sydney take some time before jumping back into work.
  * Sydney wants to start feeling normal again and thinks this is the best way to do it.
- The CIA has agreed to trade Sark for the remaining agent, even though they don't know why The Covenant wants him.
  * Sark may be responsible for the death of a high ranking member within The Covenant.
  * Sydney is against the trade and doesn't trust Sloane, who provided the intelligence.
- Sydney goes to a group meeting for people who have experienced lost time.
  * Dixon thinks it will be helpful for her.
  * Sydney is unsure about being a part of the group.
- Sydney and Weiss go to Mexico for the exchange with The Covenant.
  * The exchange is ambushed by Delta Force, led by Lindsay.
  * The Covenant gets away with both Sark and Rotter.
- Sydney finds out that Vaughn is back at the CIA and will be working with her again.
  * She is determined to act professionally, even though she still has feelings for him.
  * Vaughn is worried about how Sydney will react to his return.

• The FBI is considering severing the partnership between Booth and Brennan due to Booth's arrest of Brennan's father.
   • Booth and Brennan are sent to therapy with a young therapist named Sweets.
   • Booth and Brennan are resistant to the therapy and are given a personality test as homework.
   • Brennan and Booth continue to bicker about environmentalism and organic farming.

• Booth and Brennan are called to a crime scene where a body has been found on an abandoned VA hospital property.
   • The victim is a wealthy organic food entrepreneur named Franklin Curtis.
   • The body is found to have been cooked before being dumped at the site.
   • Booth and Brennan investigate the cause of death and the motive behind the murder.

• Booth and Brennan visit the Curtis family farm and interview the victim's wife and daughter.
   • They learn that the victim was known for his ambition and had many enemies.
   • They also learn that the victim was trying to convert a local farmer named Andrew Harding to organic farming.
   • Booth and Brennan visit Harding and question him about his relationship with the victim.

• Booth and Brennan continue to investigate the murder and interview potential suspects.
   • They visit a local composting facility and find evidence of another body.
   • They also find evidence of pineapple beetles on the victim's clothing, leading them to a local farmer who grows pineapples.
   • Booth and Brennan visit the farmer and find more evidence linking him to the murder.

• Booth and Brennan solve the case and discover that the victim's daughter was the murderer.
   • The daughter had killed the victim's mistress in a fit of jealousy and then killed her father to cover up the crime.
   • Booth and Brennan confront the daughter and she confesses to the murders.
   • The case is closed and Booth and Brennan continue their partnership.

• Prue is worried about her sister Prue, who has been acting strangely and fixated on the triad.
	• Meanwhile, Piper is dealing with her own issues, as she feels like she is being watched and is unable to concentrate on her relationship with Leo.
	• At the same time, Phoebe is flirting with Cole, but is also worried about Piper and Prue.
	• Prue discovers that someone has broken into the house and smashed all the mirrors.
	• Darryl is called to investigate and the sisters give him a list of their enemies, both past and present.
	• Prue becomes convinced that the triad is behind the break-in and is determined to find out more about them.
	• Leo is unable to provide much information, as the triad is a powerful and secretive organization.
	• Prue sets a trap in the attic to catch the intruder and is attacked by an invisible demon named Troxa.
	• Troxa reveals that there is another demon named Belthazor who is also after the sisters before he is vanquished.

• The text is about a dance at Degrassi Community School
• There are several subplots involving different characters

- Terri, a overweight girl, is unsure about attending the dance
• She is worried that no one will want to dance with her because of her weight
• With the help of her friends Ashley and Paige, she decides to go to the dance

- Sean, a new student, is also unsure about attending the dance
• He is self-conscious about having to repeat the 7th grade
• He ends up going to the dance with Jimmy

- Ashley, a student council member, is in charge of the dance
• She is worried about the turnout and wants everything to go perfectly
• She is also concerned about Terri and her decision not to attend the dance

- JT and Toby plan to stay home and look at porn on the internet
• Their plans are ruined when Toby's parents come home early
• They are forced to look at porn with their parents as a lesson

- Emma asks Sean to dance with her at the dance
• Sean, who is standoffish and intimidating, agrees
• They have a good time dancing together

- Terri gets drunk at the dance and makes a scene
• She tells Spinner that she loves him and they dance together
• She later throws up in the bathroom and Ashley takes care of her

- The next day at school, Terri is embarrassed about what happened at the dance
• Emma tells her that there will be another dance next semester
• Spinner returns Terri's notes and Paige tells him that she will be using her notes from now on.

<summary>

* Adam Newman's body was found and identified through DNA testing
  - The body was burned beyond recognition but was identified through DNA on record from Adam's time in prison
* The Newman ranch is being searched as part of a homicide investigation
  - A search warrant was served and the staff was asked to remain downstairs
* Jack Abbott is a person of interest in the case due to a monogrammed handkerchief found in Adam's throat
  - The handkerchief was traced to a Seville row haberdasher in London and is monogrammed with "J.A."
* Victor Newman is also a person of interest due to a watch with Adam's blood on it
  - The watch was found in a bag in the trash and is worth more than an assistant D.A. makes in a year
* Nick Newman's jacket with a bloodstain is hidden to protect him
  - Phyllis found the jacket with a big bloodstain on the sleeve and hid it to protect Nick
* Abby Newman meets Ryder and they plan to meet again in secret.
  - Abby and Ryder met at the Genoa City Athletic Club and plan to meet again in secret.
</summary>
